DialogueData.Text: A voice on the PA announces the start of class in five minutes. Look for your classroom in the northwest corner.

DialogueData.Speaker: Student
DialogueData.Text: They say aliens have been attacking students here lately.

DialogueData.Speaker: Student
DialogueData.Text: Better be careful walking around.

DialogueData.Speaker: Jaime
DialogueData.Text: (Several flyers have been posted here by the administration...)
Remember that aliens aren't real and cannot hurt you! If you see an alien, stay calm and continue your current task.
Under no cirumstances are students allowed use arcane technomagics to battle aliens. Which aren't real.

DialogueData.Speaker: Jaime
DialogueData.Text: (... But everyone knows aliens are real now. That's why I had to learn arcane technomagic.)
It's almost time for class to begin. Look for your classroom in the northwest corner marked on your minimap with a star.

DialogueData.Speaker: Abby
DialogueData.Text: Hey, aren't you supposed to be in math right now?

DialogueData.Speaker: Abby
DialogueData.Text: You can't keep hanging out in my class and causing trouble. The teacher will yell at you again.
There's an alien standing in the middle of your class. Students huddle in a corner away from the alien's malevolent psychic aura.

DialogueData.Speaker: Alien
DialogueData.Text: Efficient consumption protocols demand you continue being warehoused at this location in a small and cramped space.

DialogueData.Speaker: Alien
DialogueData.Text: Please disregard my presence and the dangerous psychic probes being conducted on your vulnerable minds.

DialogueData.Speaker: Jaime
DialogueData.Text: (It's clearly using dangerous psychic powers. I have no choice... I'll have to subdue the alien with arcane technomagic.)

DialogueData.Speaker: Student
DialogueData.Text: What do we do now?

DialogueData.Speaker: Teacher
DialogueData.Text: Aliens are inside the school now. It's no longer safe, we have to evacuate every student.

DialogueData.Speaker: Jaime
DialogueData.Text: (My friend Abby is in the next classroom over. I should check up on her.)
Abby alone is standing up to the alien tyranizing her classroom. It demands we stop teaching alien subject matters that we've never heard of.
This alien is probably a drone controlled by remote intelligences to enact some kind of cryptic objective.
Abby looks around the room for support and turns to you.

DialogueData.Speaker: Abby
DialogueData.Text: Hey I was just joking about what I said earlier. Can you help me out?

DialogueData.Speaker: Abby
DialogueData.Text: Hey I'm glad you're here. You know how to handle something like this, right?

DialogueData.Speaker: Abby
DialogueData.Text: What was going on with those metal blocks during that battle? Scoring a combo right next to any metal blocks will break them all at once, right?

DialogueData.Speaker: Jaime
DialogueData.Text: I'll tell you all about it later, just get everyone outside while I go check out the east corridor.

DialogueData.Speaker: Arcane Student
DialogueData.Text: Oh, you're using arcane technomagic too? Let me tell you about something useful.

DialogueData.Speaker: Arcane Student
DialogueData.Text: If you don't see any blocks that can be matched into a combo, trying using [Push] instead to get more blocks.

DialogueData.Speaker: Arcane Student
DialogueData.Text: It can be dangerous to push your blocks up too high, but you'll be able to score more combos and chains.

DialogueData.Speaker: Arcane Student
DialogueData.Text: You might need to score a big combo or chain to even damage the crystal aliens in the east corridor.

DialogueData.Speaker: Arcane Student
DialogueData.Text: A few of us started learning how to fight back against the aliens. I guess you've heard about it too?

DialogueData.Speaker: Arcane Student
DialogueData.Text: Do you also know about chain scoring? Blocks that fall after a combo and score additional combos are worth a higher score.

DialogueData.Speaker: Arcane Student
DialogueData.Text: The bigger your combos, and the longer your chains, that's what fuels arcane technomagic.

DialogueData.Speaker: Arcane Student
DialogueData.Text: Some aliens take more or less damage from certain colors. Only the first color combo matters for defining the color of your attack though.
Another alien unsuccessfully tries to convince your classmates it doesn't exist while projecting harmful auras.

DialogueData.Speaker: Jaime
DialogueData.Text: Everyone get out while you can! The aliens are trying to keep us in here and it's not safe.
There isn't anybody in this room. They must have evacuated already.
Powerful resonance has been left in this room. After collecting it, your arcane technomagic becomes more powerful.
Your attacks should deal 1.25x more damage now.

DialogueData.Speaker: Teacher
DialogueData.Text: Minister, my students are being attacked by aliens. In my professional opinion, it no longer is safe to remain in this building.

DialogueData.Speaker: Education Minister
DialogueData.Text: here's no such thing as aliens. That's just nonsense, okay? Now get your kids back in there.

DialogueData.Speaker: Education Minister
DialogueData.Text: I don't care if they're learning or not. I just need to keep them somewhere while their parents work at the alien base.

DialogueData.Speaker: Education Minister
DialogueData.Text: Aaah I can feel the alien technology overtaking me. You will pay for your defiance...
You have successfully evacuated the school. This concludes the game. Thank you for playing!
